title: Do you have good dining etiquette?
intro: Do you know the 'proper' way to behave during meals? And what would be the worst thing someone could do while eating? This episode is all about etiquette, what makes good table manners and what is considered rude! Phil and Pippa discuss this and teach you some new vocabulary.
this_week_question: According to BBC programme The Food Chain, what was the most common complaint from listeners around the world about eating manners in their country?
a) people eating with their hands b) people eating noisily c) people burping at the table
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

vocab.desc: rules about how you should and should not behave in a particular situation first impression the opinion you form about someone when you meet them for the first time picky used to describe someone who is too strict about rules clink glasses touch two drinking glasses together as a gesture of friendship toast show of respect for someone that involves holding up and drinking from a glass of alcohol a no-no (informal) something that is thought to be socially unsuitable or unacceptable
